author: profd2004
title: Opensource PHP SDK for COTI ADA Pay
description: 超过75%的网站使用PHP，但没有高质量的Cardano本地SDK来支持ADA支付。

f6_assessments.q0:
这个建议完全与挑战相一致，我认为首先为COTI AdaPay集成创建一个PHP SDK，然后为Woocommerce和Laravel创建插件的方法非常聪明，是使用模块化方法优化开发的好办法。
选择使用PHP，考虑到其在世界范围内广泛采用的网站开发，这是完美的，可以为COTI AdaPay的采用提供巨大的推动力，从而促进Cardano的采用和传播。
缺少一颗星是因为缺乏关于支付的用户体验的细节（只从商家的角度提到了用户界面），但在挑战书中明确提到要描述客户的用户体验是什么。
f6_assessments.q1:
提出 "Lidonation "倡议的人是著名的社区成员，他们已经得到了一些提案的资助，而且根据他们的Linkedin资料，他们可能具备开发所提交项目的技能。
同时，也没有关于以前开发的项目的github链接。关于以前使用该提案所需技能开发的项目，唯一的迹象是。
- lidonation网站，如提案中所述，似乎是用Laravel开发的。
- https://electricbikereview.com/，该网站是用Wordpress开发的。
如果能解释一下为上述网站开发了哪些自定义插件，并在可能的情况下，分享代码库，以便更好地了解提案人的技能，那就更好了。目前，仅凭所提供的信息，我们不可能对其有一个完整的概述。
从技术角度来看，最好能提供更多关于技术方面的信息：SDK将为哪个版本的PHP开发？哪些已经开发的包将被使用？它将在packagist上发布并通过composer提供？
提到了对商家的电子邮件和电话支持，但没有说明SDK和插件将被维护多少时间，最好能增加这类细节。
预算明细仅由两部分组成。开发和支持。
如果能有一个更详细的明细表，看看开发的各个部分对总成本的影响有多大（例如，SDK开发，文档，测试，Wordpress插件开发，Laravel包开发的估计时间），那就更好了。65美元/小时的费用是相当高的(即使我知道不同的国家会有很大的不同)，最好能提供更深入的理由。
最好能包括项目各部分交付的时间表或里程碑, 目前只能估计到开发需要320个小时.
f6_assessments.q2:
正如在可行性报告中所说，该提案缺乏一个路线图和项目各部分交付的时间表，这种类型的信息对于帮助社区跟踪该提案的进展可能是至关重要的。
没有指出KPI，对于这个项目来说，保持跟踪会很好。
- Github提交/问题/每个部分（SDK，Laravel插件，Wordpress插件）的开发的里程碑
- 使用/下载SDK/Wordpress插件/Laravel软件包的网站数量
- 使用SDK完成的交易数量(并指出保持跟踪的方法，如与COTI AdaPay API的通信中的签名)
- 电子邮件/电话支持的数量

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal meets the challenge set in the fund and looks to help develop an SDK that can be used to integrate a plug-in to PHP-based items.  This scalable to people building websites using PHP as the base server-side language, which is a popular one, with WordPress as an example.
f6_assessments.q1: There is relevant experience in the team to deliver such a project with vast experience developing front- and back-end solutions.   There are little details on how the execution would go, but details on what the solution would include are available.
f6_assessments.q2: There is a description of what the solution is, but there is little details on how the solution will be built and the resources necessary for the project will be.  The additional funds allocated towards "technical support" are extensive and not really apart of the product development.

f6_assessments.q0: They identify the problem of integrating ADA pay into existing payment systems. They are already actively adding value to Cardano system themselves on other platforms and their PHP SDK will surely do the same if implemented successfully. They have a website ready for integration testing and that in itself is a KPI that aligns with the Challenge.  Adding more ecommerce related KPIs would have revealed the degree of alignment with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: They provide evidence of relevant skills with an already built website that is going to be the test playground for their first integration when their plugin is ready. Budget is broken down into identifiable items and seems reasonable for the tasks they plan to complete. They didn't provide any timetable to show when work gets completed. People need to know you have some goal of completing this project. Setting a time, also shows that you are committed. They explain in detail what is needed and how they will build this. They also consider the risk of not finding a suitable opensource framework and aim to work with Plutus developers from the community to build their own alternative solution.
f6_assessments.q2: They don't have a roadmap with milestones or KPIs in place. The one Milestone/KPI could be the website they have ready for testing their plugin. It would've been great to have more metrics to measure the performance of this project.  There is also no completion date. The problem and solution is clearly defined by creating an open source PHP SDK for ADA Pay. PHP already being used by many ecommerce websites.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal has some good points in it and at the same time it is aligned with the main ideas of the challenge. The core idea of developing a plug-in that could be used in any Laravel or WordPress site has a good range of impact. The team seems to undoubtedly identify the problem within the challenge and if successful the proposal will certainly overcome this problem. Unfortunately, not many metrics were given which makes it difficult to assess if the team clearly knows how to determine if they are on the right track. Also, no concern with the scalability problem was shown which is worrying since it is a crucial point.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal shows some strong points to support the thesis that is a feasible proposal, but at the same time a lot of other points are missing. There is enough evidence that the team has relevant skills and experience that are needed. The budget proposed is within acceptable limits, but it is not broken down enough to determine if it has a fair value. Also, no timeline was proposed which is serious. Some more information such as a strategy in case additional funding is necessary or in case the team finds out they will not be able to meet the deadlines would be welcoming. Unexpected challenges regarding scalability and integrations could have been discussed as well.
f6_assessments.q2: There is very little evidence to show enough information was provided to audit the progress and success of the proposal. No relevant KPIs were discussed. The roadmap and milestones are not clear, and the timeline was not even discussed. Even if the problem was well described, the way the solution addresses the problem is not scrutinized. In turn, it makes it hard for anyone to gauge if progress is as expected at each stage.

f6_assessments.q0:
I am not sure behind the intent of this proposal. I will elaborate on my reasoning.

As a senior developer myself, i can surely say that the AdaPay integration via plugin should be the target of this challenge settings. However, this proposal takes this challenge a step further and talks about providing an SDK which will also be used for some already in progress project by the proposer. 

Therefore, to me it seems this is an additional point just for the sake of supporting this SDK development. In my opinion, to have adapay integration via plugin does not require or in any sense help further with meeting the goals of this challenge. Why would we need an SDK when a simple plugin integration with ecommerce sites is the  success criterion for this challenge settings. 

Therefore, i am more on the direction of disagreeing with this proposal in this challenge settings. My suggestion would have been to put this in open source challenge for cardano. But since, the proposal is well written and touch bases the plugin development for AdaPay, i will stay neutral and neither agree or disagree with it
f6_assessments.q1:
From the perspective of the experience, the relevant experience is given but details of the team is missing.

The main proposer is clearly quite active in Cardano eco system and perhaps has good experience with development. However, from the budget point of view it seems that there is only one developer (the proposer) who will be working on this project (atleast this is so becasue no other details of team is presented in this proposal).

There is also written that they might have to collaborate with plutus devs  to generate smart contract generator, but it is not really mentioned in proposal, how is smart contract generator fits into AdaPay solution integration with ecommerce. It would help  a lot to a simple voter (who is not coming from tech background) if the proposal is written in a manner that is visually clear, outlining the thoughts of proposer in text clearly. 

The budget outlined (in comparison to total allocation which is around 30% of total challenge budget) is on high side, when it does not even match up the success criterion of this challenge settings. e.g. " innovative plug-in that will be integrated with our current ADA Pay system on the one hand and support all the different e-commerce software mentioned above (both shopify and woocommerce)".  IMO there is no need of an SDK and removing that part will significantly bring down the costs to implement this proposal. There are other proposals in this challenge which fulfil exact success criterion of challenge in less budget.

Additionally, technical details such as QA (load testing, UAT), scalability metrics etc are missing. All in all , i feel there is a lot of improvement needed and also this might not be the good fit for this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2:
The information provided here imo is not sufficient to audit the progress and success of this proposal. 

An overall budget is mentioned, but plan has not been broken down into milestones, feature sets etc. This proposal, therefore, imo has much room for improvement. 

For the community/voter it will give much more confidence when the proposer additionally gives a good break down of challenges/risks associated with the proposal. One risk, imo is that the if the main developer for some reason is unable to contribute then who others can basically pick up the responsibility to carry on the implementation of this project ? 

The positive is that proposer is open to collaborate with similar ideas, but nevertheless i feel that auditing the progress and success of this proposal requires more detailed information in terms of 3, 6, 12 months or weeks of deliverables. How the success will look like ? ON successful implementation, will there be OR how many businesses using the plugin/SDK ?

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem needing to be solved has been identified and articulated namely no high quality Cardano native SDK for supporting ADA Payment


 
It is clear that this proposal falls within the scope of the challenge brief Create a PHP SDK (batteries included), wrapped with a Laravel & Woocommerce plugin for adding ADA Pay to any Laravel or Wordpress site.

 
This proposal shows how it adds value to the Cardano system by creating such a solution
 
  Key metrics  would be  number of users, no of wallets, no of fiat transactions, no of ADA transactions.
 

The key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
   
Proposal can be scaled up to address future challenges by adding more businesses who use the same solution

This project will have a positive impact on Cardano system by enabling small businesses to get on board.

I can say that this proposal adequately addresses the challenge  hence i have given it a 5 star rating.


I am qualified to write this assessment based on being a translator since 1992 at the State Broadcasting Corporation as well as since that time,running my own translation agency, working with the two native languages of my country as well as working on various translation projects into other languages, including translation, transcription and proofreading. I have also been an event organizer in various capacities, both through my company and on a voluntary basis for youth groups and churches.  I also have run a web development company from 1997 and have been the author of many ground breaking projects in web and Flash related projects in my country including payment gateway containing sites.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposers  have provided ample evidence  of themselves with their skills and experience in  required skills. 
  
 The links are sufficient. 
 
I have visited these links  
  
 
The proposers are well experienced and competent to do the project
 
 The type and number of team members required to implement the proposal is stated.
 
 
The team structure is listed and experienced.
 
 
 The budget has been given in detail. 
 
The budget is  reasonable to achieve the set goals. 
 
 
The proposer has not provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required  
 

There is no plan for additional funding  if objectives are not met. 

Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
 
Theres a realistic timetable  to complete the work

Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
 
The proposal gives  a sensible and conductible plan for implementation.  .

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?

Resources  necessary to implement the proposal are described.   
  
The proposal has technical aspects which have been addressed 
 
The proposer has not identified risks in this proposal  
 
Given experience and plan presented it is  highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully
 This proposal is detailed and budget is reasonable hence I have given it a 5 star rating.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is a roadmap with milestones  

 
 There are  Metrics such of number of users, no of wallets, no of transactions, time taken, amount of fees saved, amount of time saved on each transaction.
   
The problem has been clearly understood and solution has been given in much detail.
  
 
    The proposer has not identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties. 
 
Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
 

Nonetheless one piece of advice for the proposer.  Make as many metrics which you can track easily. Use Trello or Notion or some similar project management tool.


The information provided is  sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal hence I have given it a  5 star rating.

f6_assessments.q0: Great thinking outside the box. Most proposers plan on using API but by opting for an SDK you not only give the consumer the tools to implement ADA pay but you also give them your whole workspace so they are not bound by the boundaries of an API. Focusing on PHP is a solid decision since most e-comm and CMS platforms work on PHP.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding feasibility, we are missing some important details. The proposers are saying that they have over fourteen years of experience in software, cloud engineering,... The issue here is that they don't provide actual evidence to support this. They provide a link to their website but this provides only information about Cardano and not themselves. The roadmap is also missing which leaves us in the blue about what the proposers are really planning on doing. The budget breakdown is present but only rudimental. we need a deeper understanding as to why 12000 is needed for email/phone support.
f6_assessments.q2: As mentioned in the above rationale no roadmap is provided what makes it hard to assess auditability as well. We do have some guidelines represented but this does not give the proper details about what still needs to happen and how much time it would take. Also think about metrics, How much adaption are you thinking about when making the oho SDK.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal seeks to address COTI challenge by creating a PHP SDK (batteries included), wrapped with a Laravel & Woocommerce plugin. The goals clearly align with the challenge setting.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers possess the skill that complement one another to steer this implementation to the success. However, the proposal is ranked 3 due to the budget for the phone and email support seem a bit high. Hopefully they would revise the budget for email and phone support  to be more reasonable.
f6_assessments.q2: Since they are open for collaboration, it would be fair to revise the budget down and also detail the arrangement like how they can work with partners to achieve project goals successfully.

f6_assessments.q0:
I wholeheartedly believe that the solutions given will solve the problem perfectly.
Interesting idea with huge potential. Looking at this proposal, I can only say that it is a perfect fit for the challenge. This is a great idea. It is proposed to be able to extend the ADA Pay application by creating a PHP SDK.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal does not provide a realistic timeline for completing the work. The proposal did not consider the challenges and risks associated with successful adoption. Looks like the proponent needs more colleagues if you want this proposal to be successful.
The experience here is very important. The proposal consists of 2 members Stephanie and Darlington with a basic description, the feasibility of the proposal can be easily measured if there is specific documentation of their success, or at least provide LinkedIn, Twitter page, Facebook for the community to understand more about them
f6_assessments.q2:
There is no detailed implementation plan. We'd love to see your blueprints for the future.
Proposing a step-by-step plan isn't good for developing clear and time-bound milestones. The budget given is very general and therefore I cannot say whether it is suitable or not
This proposal is difficult to test because there is no yardstick to measure success and there is no specific roadmap in this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The team states the problem in the proposal and offers a very good solution. This idea definitely has a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem if it is to be realized. The team clearly explains how this project can add value to the Cardano ecosystem. Unfortunately, KPIs are not elaborated or listed so it's hard to compare KPIs with challenge setting and the proposal is not able to scale and address future challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: The team in the proposal provides links from which the work so far is visible and we are clearly presented that the team of two people has the necessary skills, knowledge and experience. The proposal presents a budget that gives us a clear insight into how the funds will be allocated. Maybe the team is asking for a little too much funding to run this project but that's just my opinion. It would be good for the team to develop a detailed implementable plan and details of actionable tasks and an order of execution with time frames within which the work will be done. It would also be great to list the necessary resources and technical aspects if they are of great importance for implementation. When carrying out any project, certain risks can always arise, so it would be good to have an idea of the possible risks.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, the team for some reason omits the roadmap with milestones and the horizon for achievement probably due to lack of knowledge of how to prepare a proposal. KPIs have not been mentioned or presented so unfortunately the community can't track the success of this project.

f6_assessments.q0: The goal of the proposal does meet the goals of the challenge. technical details specific to the ADApay integration are lacking. The proposal includes a 12000 budget for 1 year of phone and email support which seems premature considering the development that needs to happen.
f6_assessments.q1: The team are motivated members of the Cardano ecosystem and speak intelligently about the project at hand. I wish they would focus more on the technical details related to ADApay integration. The fact that they are budgeting in 1 year of phone/email support makes me think that they are thinking too big and a more modest proposal would seem more feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The detailed plan does include clear goals and steps, but the path to acieve them is not clearly defined.  No timeline is given.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal has some interesting idea to further expand adoption of Ada Plugin integrations to WordPress websites. 
The problem statement is definitely inline with the challenge set goals and objectives and the solution is more than promising positive impact on the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no detailed information about the competence of the team. 
However, the notion to collaborate with other developers and  Cori Experts is encouraging. 
In addition, the budget breakdown still needs to be well defined in clear terms plus the fact there is no well detailed step-by-step roadmap to implementing the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has not provided any form of metrics or KPIs to assess the project's performance if funded.

It may helpful to provide key metrics such as the number of website that will integrate this plugin, the no. of uers' adoption on this e-commerce sites, number of customers complaints and enquires upon processing payments transactions.

solution: 创建一个PHP SDK（包括电池），用Laravel & Woocommerce插件包装，用于在任何Laravel或Wordpress网站上添加ADA Pay。
experience: 14+年 软件和云计算工程，区块链开发，商业咨询，世界语言，技术写作，教学。
